items.name: Ext.data.Store
associatedEntity
items.text: The owner of this store if the store is used as part of an association.

items.name: asynchronousLoad
items.text: This defaults to `true` when this store's cfg-proxy is asynchronous, such as an Ext.data.proxy.Ajax. When the proxy is synchronous, such as a Ext.data.proxy.Memory memory proxy, this defaults to `false`. *NOTE:* This does not cause synchronous Ajax requests if configured `false` when an Ajax proxy is used. It causes immediate issuing of an Ajax request when method-load is called rather than issuing the request at the end of the current event handler run. What this means is that when using an Ajax proxy, calls to method-load do not fire the request to the remote resource immediately, but schedule a request to be made. This is so that multiple requests are not fired when mutating a store's remote filters and sorters (as happens during state restoration). The request is made only once after all relevant store state is fully set.

items.name: autoDestroy
items.text: When a Store is used by only one Ext.view.View, and should only exist for the lifetime of that view, then configure the autoDestroy flag as `true`. This causes the destruction of the view to trigger the destruction of its Store.

items.name: autoLoad
items.text: If data is not specified, and if autoLoad is true or an Object, this store's load method is automatically called after creation. If the value of autoLoad is an Object, this Object will be passed to the store's load method. It's important to note that Ext.data.TreeStore will load regardless of autoLoad's value if expand is set to true on the Ext.data.TreeStore#root.

items.name: autoSort
items.text:
`true` to maintain sorted order when records
are added regardless of requested insertion point, or when an item mutation
results in a new sort position.

This does not affect a ChainedStore's reaction to mutations of the source
Store. If sorters are present when the source Store is mutated, this ChainedStore's
sort order will always be maintained.

items.name: autoSync
items.text: True to automatically sync the Store with its Proxy after every edit to one of its Records. Defaults to false.

items.name: batchUpdateMode
items.text:
Sets the updating behavior based on batch synchronization. 'operation' (the default) will update the Store's
internal representation of the data after each operation of the batch has completed, 'complete' will wait until
the entire batch has been completed before updating the Store's data. 'complete' is a good choice for local
storage proxies, 'operation' is better for remote proxies, where there is a comparatively high latency.

items.name: clearOnPageLoad
items.text: True to empty the store when loading another page via loadPage, nextPage or previousPage. Setting to false keeps existing records, allowing large data sets to be loaded one page at a time but rendered all together.

items.name: clearRemovedOnLoad
items.text: `true` to clear anything in the removed record collection when the store loads.

items.name: data
items.text:
Array of Model instances or data objects to load locally. See "Inline data"
above for details.

items.localDoc: **Note:** In general, this configuration option should only be used for simple stores like a two-field store of ComboBox. For anything more complicated, such as specifying a particular id property or associations, a Model should be defined and specified for the model config.
items.name: fields
filters
groupDir
items.text: The direction in which sorting should be applied when grouping. Supported values are "ASC" and "DESC".

items.name: grouper
items.text: The grouper by which to group the data store. May also be specified by the groupField config, however they should not be used together.

items.name: groupField
items.text: The field by which to group data in the store. Internally, grouping is very similar to sorting - the groupField and groupDir are injected as the first sorter (see method-sort). Stores support a single level of grouping, and groups can be fetched via the getGroups method.

items.name: listeners
model
items.text: Name of the Ext.data.Model associated with this store. See Ext.data.Model#entityName. May also be the actual Model subclass. This config is required for the store to be able to read data unless you have defined the fields config which will create an anonymous Ext.data.Model.

items.name: pageSize
items.text: The number of records considered to form a 'page'. This is used to power the built-in paging using the nextPage and previousPage functions when the grid is paged using a Ext.toolbar.Paging Defaults to 25. To disable paging, set the pageSize to `0`.

items.name: proxy
items.text: The Proxy to use for this Store. This can be either a string, a config object or a Proxy instance - see setProxy for details.

items.name: remoteFilter
items.text: `true` to defer any filtering operation to the server. If `false`, filtering is done locally on the client.

items.name: remoteSort
items.text: `true` if the sorting should be performed on the server side, false if it is local only.

items.name: role
items.text: The role for the associatedEntity.

items.name: session
items.text:
The session for this store. By specifying a session, it ensures any records that are
added to this store are also included in the session. This store does not become a member
of the session itself.

items.name: sorters
items.text: The initial set of Ext.util.Sorter

items.name: sortOnLoad
items.text: If true, any sorters attached to this Store will be run after loading data, before the datachanged event is fired. Defaults to true, ignored if Ext.data.Store#remoteSort is true

items.name: statefulFilters
items.text: Configure as `true` to have the filters saved when a client Ext.grid.Panel saves its state.

items.name: storeId
items.text: Unique identifier for this store. If present, this Store will be registered with the Ext.data.StoreManager, making it easy to reuse elsewhere. Note that when a store is instantiated by a Controller, the storeId will default to the name of the store if not specified in the class.

items.name: trackRemoved
items.text:
This config controls whether removed records are remembered by this store for
later saving to the server.

items.name: add
items.text: Fired when a Model instance has been added to this Store.

items.name: store
items.text: The store.

items.name: records
items.text: The records that were added.

items.name: index
items.text: The index at which the records were inserted.

items.name: beforeload
items.text:
Fires before a request is made for a new data object. If the beforeload handler returns false the load
action will be canceled.

items.name: store
items.text: This Store

items.name: operation
items.text:
The Ext.data.operation.Operation object that will be passed to the Proxy to
load the Store

items.name: beforeprefetch
items.text: Fires before a prefetch occurs. Return `false` to cancel.

items.name: operation
items.text: The associated operation.

items.name: beforesort
items.text: Fires before a store is sorted. For remoteSort stores, this will be just before the load operation triggered by changing the store's sorters. For locally sorted stores, this will be just before the data items in the store's backing collection are sorted.

items.name: store
items.text: The store being sorted

items.name: sorters
items.text: Array of sorters applied to the store

items.name: beforesync
items.text: Fired before a call to sync is executed. Return false from any listener to cancel the sync

items.name: options
items.text: Hash of all records to be synchronized, broken down into create, update and destroy

items.name: beginupdate
items.text: Fires when the beginUpdate method is called. Automatic synchronization as configured by the Ext.data.ProxyStore#autoSync flag is deferred until the endUpdate method is called, so multiple mutations can be coalesced into one synchronization operation.

items.name: clear
items.text: Fired after the Ext.data.Store#removeAll method is called.

items.name: datachanged
items.text: Fires whenever records are added to or removed from the Store. To hook into modifications of records in this Store use the update event.

items.name: this
items.text: The data store

items.name: endupdate
items.text: Fires when the endUpdate method is called. Automatic synchronization as configured by the Ext.data.ProxyStore#autoSync flag is deferred until the endUpdate method is called, so multiple mutations can be coalesced into one synchronization operation.

items.name: filterchange
items.text: Fired whenever the filter set changes.

items.name: store
items.text: The store.

items.name: filters
items.text: The array of Filter objects.

items.name: groupchange
items.text: Fired whenever the grouping in the grid changes.

items.name: store
items.text: The store.

items.name: grouper
items.text: The grouper object.

items.name: load
items.text: Fires whenever the store reads data from a remote data source.

items.name: records
items.text: An array of records

items.name: successful
items.text: True if the operation was successful.

items.name: operation
items.text: The Ext.data.operation.Read object that was used in the data load call

items.name: metachange
items.text:
Fires when this store's underlying reader (available via the proxy) provides new metadata.
Metadata usually consists of new field definitions, but can include any configuration data
required by an application, and can be processed as needed in the event handler.
This event is currently only fired for JsonReaders.

items.name: meta
items.text: The JSON metadata

items.name: prefetch
items.text: Fires whenever records have been prefetched.

items.name: records
items.text: An array of records.

items.name: successful
items.text: `true` if the operation was successful.

items.name: operation
items.text: The associated operation.

items.name: refresh
items.text:
Fires when the data cache has changed in a bulk manner (e.g., it has been sorted, filtered, etc.) and a
widget that is using this Store as a Record cache should refresh its view.

items.name: this
items.text: The data store

items.name: remove
items.text:
Fired when one or more records have been removed from this Store.

**The signature for this event has changed in 5.0: **

items.name: store
items.text: The Store object

items.name: records
items.text:
The records that were removed. In previous
releases this was a single record, not an array.

items.name: index
items.text: The index at which the records were removed.

items.name: isMove
items.text:
`true` if the child node is being removed so it can be
moved to another position in this Store.

items.name: sort
items.text: Fires after a store is sorted. For remoteSort stores, this will be upon the success of a load operation triggered by changing the store's sorters. For locally sorted stores, this will be just after the data items in the store's backing collection are sorted.

items.name: store
items.text: The store being sorted

items.name: update
items.text: Fires when a Model instance has been updated.

items.name: record
items.text: The Model instance that was updated

items.name: operation
items.text:
The update operation being performed. Value may be one of:

    Ext.data.Model.EDIT
    Ext.data.Model.REJECT
    Ext.data.Model.COMMIT

items.name: modifiedFieldNames
items.text: Array of field names changed during edit.

items.name: details
items.text: An object describing the change. See the Ext.util.Collection#event-itemchange of the store's backing collection

items.name: write
items.text: Fires whenever a successful write has been made via the configured proxy

items.name: store
items.text: This Store

items.name: operation
items.text: The Ext.data.operation.Operation object that was used in the write

items.name: _addDeclaredListeners
items.text: Adds declarative listeners as nested arrays of listener objects.
`true` if any listeners were added

items.name: addAfterListener
items.text: Alias for onAfter.

items.name: addBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for onBefore.

items.name: addFilter
items.text: Adds a new Filter to this Store's cfg-filters and by default, applies the updated filter set to the Store's unfiltered dataset.

items.name: filters
items.text: The set of filters to add to the current cfg-filters.

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: If `true` the filter is cleared silently.

items.name: addListener
eventName
items.text:
The name of the event to listen for.
May also be an object who's property names are event names.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes or the *name* of the method within the specified `scope`. Will be called with arguments given to Ext.util.Observable#fireEvent plus the `options` parameter described below.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text:
An object containing handler configuration.

**Note:** The options object will also be passed as the last argument to every
event handler.

This object may contain any of the following properties:

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is executed. **If omitted,
  defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: delay
items.text:
The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event
  fires.

items.name: single
items.text:
True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove
  itself.

items.name: buffer
items.text: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is _not_ invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

items.name: onFrame
items.text: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run at the next Ext.Function#requestAnimationFrame. If the event fires again before that time, the handler is not rescheduled - the handler will only be called once when the next animation frame is fired, with the last set of arguments passed.

items.name: target
items.text:
Only call the handler if the event was fired on the target Observable, _not_ if the
  event was bubbled up from a child Observable.

items.name: element
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.Component.** The name of a Component property which references an Ext.dom.Element to add a listener to. This option is useful during Component construction to add DOM event listeners to elements of Ext.Component which will exist only after the Component is rendered. For example, to add a click listener to a Panel's body: var panel = new Ext.panel.Panel({ title: 'The title', listeners: { click: this.handlePanelClick, element: 'body' } }); In order to remove listeners attached using the element, you'll need to reference the element itself as seen below. panel.body.un(...)

items.name: delegate
items.text:
A simple selector to filter the event target or look for a descendant of the target.

  The "delegate" option is only available on Ext.dom.Element instances (or
  when attaching a listener to a Ext.dom.Element via a Component using the
  element option).

  See the *delegate* example below.

items.name: stopPropagation
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#stopPropagation on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: preventDefault
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#preventDefault on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: stopEvent
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#stopEvent on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: args
items.text: Optional arguments to pass to the handler function. Any additional arguments passed to Ext.util.Observable#fireEvent will be appended to these arguments.

items.name: destroyable
items.text: When specified as `true`, the function returns a `destroyable` object. An object which implements the `destroy` method which removes all listeners added in this call. This syntax can be a helpful shortcut to using un; particularly when removing multiple listeners. *NOTE* - not compatible when using the _element_ option. See un for the proper syntax for removing listeners added using the _element_ config.

items.name: priority
items.text:
An optional numeric priority that determines the order in which event handlers
  are run. Event handlers with no priority will be run as if they had a priority
  of 0. Handlers with a higher priority will be prioritized to run sooner than
  those with a lower priority.  Negative numbers can be used to set a priority
  lower than the default. Internally, the framework uses a range of 1000 or
  greater, and -1000 or lesser for handlers that are intended to run before or
  after all others, so it is recommended to stay within the range of -999 to 999
  when setting the priority of event handlers in application-level code.
  A priority must be an integer to be valid.  Fractional values are reserved for
  internal framework use.

items.name: order
items.text:
A legacy option that is provided for backward compatibility.
  It is recommended to use the `priority` option instead.  Available options are:

  - `'before'`: equal to a priority of `100`
  - `'current'`: equal to a priority of `0` or default priority
  - `'after'`: equal to a priority of `-100`

items.name: order
addManagedListener
item
items.text: The item to which to add a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event
name, this is the handler function or the name of a method on the specified
`scope`.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: options
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the Ext.util.Observable#addListener options.

items.name: addSorted
items.text:
(Local sort only) Inserts the passed Record into the Store at the index where it
should go based on the current sort information.

items.name: afterCommit
items.text: A model instance should call this method on the Store it has been Ext.data.Model#join to.

items.name: record
items.text: The model instance that was edited

items.name: afterReject
items.text: A model instance should call this method on the Store it has been Ext.data.Model#join to..

items.name: record
items.text: The model instance that was edited

items.name: applyState
items.text: Restores state to the passed state

items.name: beginUpdate
clearFilter
items.text: Reverts to a view of the Record cache with no filtering applied.

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: If `true` the filter is cleared silently. For a locally filtered Store, this means that the filter collection is cleared without firing the datachanged event. For a remotely filtered Store, this means that the filter collection is cleared, but the store is not reloaded from the server.

items.name: clearGrouping
items.text: Clear the store grouping

items.name: clearListeners
items.text: Removes all listeners for this object including the managed listeners

items.name: clearManagedListeners
items.text: Removes all managed listeners for this object.

items.name: commitChanges
items.text: Commits all Records with getModifiedRecords. To handle updates for changes, subscribe to the Store's event-update, and perform updating when the third parameter is Ext.data.Record.COMMIT.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates the store.

items.name: config
items.text: Config object.

items.name: contains
items.text: Checks if a record is in the current active data set.

items.name: record
items.text: The record
`true` if the record is in the current active data set.

items.name: createModel
items.text: Converts a literal to a model, if it's not a model already

items.name: record
items.text: The record to create

items.name: createRelayer
items.text: Creates an event handling function which re-fires the event from this object as the passed event name.

items.name: newName
items.text: The name under which to re-fire the passed parameters.

items.name: beginEnd
items.text: (optional) The caller can specify on which indices to slice.

items.name: doFireEvent
items.text: Continue to fire event.

items.name: enableBubble
eventNames
items.text: The event name to bubble, or an Array of event names.

items.name: endUpdate
items.text: This method is called after modifications are complete on a store. For details see beginUpdate.

items.name: fetch
items.text:
Similar to a load, however no records are added to the store. This is useful
in allowing the developer to decide what to do with the new records.

items.name: options
items.text: See method-load.

items.name: filter
filters
items.text: Either a string name of one of the fields in this Store's configured Ext.data.Model, or an array of filter configurations.

items.name: value
items.text: The property value by which to filter. Only applicable if filters is a string.

items.name: filterBy
items.text: Filters by a function. The specified function will be called for each Record in this Store. If the function returns `true` the Record is included, otherwise it is filtered out. When store is filtered, most of the methods for accessing store data will be working only within the set of filtered records. The notable exception is getById.

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters:

items.name: record
items.text: The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Model#get.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (this reference) in which the function is executed.
Defaults to this Store.

items.name: filterNew
items.text: Filter function for new records.

items.name: filterUpdated
items.text: Filter function for updated records.

items.name: find
items.text: Finds the index of the first matching Record in this store by a specific field value. When store is filtered, finds records only within filter. **IMPORTANT If this store is Ext.data.BufferedStore, this can ONLY find records which happen to be cached in the page cache. This will be parts of the dataset around the currently visible zone, or recently visited zones if the pages have not yet been purged from the cache.**

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the Record field to test.

items.name: value
items.text:
Either a string that the field value
should begin with, or a RegExp to test against the field.

items.name: startIndex
items.text: The index to start searching at

items.name: anyMatch
items.text:
True to match any part of the string, not just the
beginning.

items.name: caseSensitive
items.text: True for case sensitive comparison

items.name: exactMatch
items.text:
True to force exact match (^ and $ characters
added to the regex). Ignored if `anyMatch` is `true`.
The matched index or -1

items.name: findBy
items.text: Find the index of the first matching Record in this Store by a function. If the function returns `true` it is considered a match. When store is filtered, finds records only within filter. **IMPORTANT If this store is Ext.data.BufferedStore, this can ONLY find records which happen to be cached in the page cache. This will be parts of the dataset around the currently visible zone, or recently visited zones if the pages have not yet been purged from the cache.**

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters:

items.name: record
items.text: The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Model#get.

items.name: id
items.text: The ID of the Record passed.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (this reference) in which the function is executed.
Defaults to this Store.

items.name: startIndex
items.text: The index to start searching at
The matched index or -1

items.name: findExact
items.text: Finds the index of the first matching Record in this store by a specific field value. When store is filtered, finds records only within filter. **IMPORTANT If this store is Ext.data.BufferedStore, this can ONLY find records which happen to be cached in the page cache. This will be parts of the dataset around the currently visible zone, or recently visited zones if the pages have not yet been purged from the cache.**

items.name: fieldName
items.text: The name of the Record field to test.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to match the field against.

items.name: startIndex
items.text: The index to start searching at
The matched index or -1

items.name: findRecord
items.text: Finds the first matching Record in this store by a specific field value. When store is filtered, finds records only within filter. **IMPORTANT If this store is Ext.data.BufferedStore, this can ONLY find records which happen to be cached in the page cache. This will be parts of the dataset around the currently visible zone, or recently visited zones if the pages have not yet been purged from the cache.**

items.name: fieldName
items.text: The name of the Record field to test.

items.name: value
items.text:
Either a string that the field value
should begin with, or a RegExp to test against the field.

items.name: startIndex
items.text: The index to start searching at

items.name: anyMatch
items.text:
True to match any part of the string, not just the
beginning.

items.name: caseSensitive
items.text: True for case sensitive comparison

items.name: exactMatch
items.text:
True to force exact match (^ and $ characters
added to the regex). Ignored if `anyMatch` is `true`.
The matched record or null

items.name: fireAction
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action). By default, the action function will be executed after any "before" event handlers (as specified using the `order` option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener), but before any other handlers are fired. This gives the "before" handlers an opportunity to cancel the event by returning `false`, and prevent the action function from being called. The action can also be configured to run after normal handlers, but before any "after" handlers (as specified using the `order` event option) by passing `'after'` as the `order` parameter. This configuration gives any event handlers except for "after" handlers the opportunity to cancel the event and prevent the action function from being called.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text: Event options for the action function. Accepts any of the options of Ext.util.Observable#addListener

items.name: order
items.text: The order to call the action function relative too the event handlers (`'before'` or `'after'`). Note that this option is simply used to sort the action function relative to the event handlers by "priority". An order of `'before'` is equivalent to a priority of `99.5`, while an order of `'after'` is equivalent to a priority of `-99.5`. See the `priority` option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener for more details.

items.name: fireEvent
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name, plus the `options` object passed to Ext.util.Observable#addListener). An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget) by calling enableBubble.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventArgs
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameter list. An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget) by calling enableBubble.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: An array of parameters which are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventedAction
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action).
Evented Actions will automatically dispatch a 'before' event passing. This event will
be given a special controller that allows for pausing/resuming of the event flow.

By pausing the controller the updater and events will not run until resumed. Pausing,
however, will not stop the processing of any other before events.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: fnArgs
items.text:
Optional arguments for the action `fn`. If not
given, the normal `args` will be used to call `fn`. If `false` is passed, the
`args` are used but if the first argument is this instance it will be removed
from the args passed to the action function.

items.name: flushLoad
items.text: Called when the event handler which called the method-load method exits.

items.name: getAt
items.text:
Get the Record at the specified index.

The index is effected by filtering.

items.name: index
items.text: The index of the Record to find.
The Record at the passed index. Returns null if not found.

items.name: getBatchListeners
items.text:
Returns an object which is passed in as the listeners argument to proxy.batch inside this.sync.
This is broken out into a separate function to allow for customisation of the listeners
The listeners object

items.name: getBubbleParent
items.text: Gets the bubbling parent for an Observable
The bubble parent. null is returned if no bubble target exists

items.name: getCount
items.text: Gets the number of records in store. If using paging, this may not be the total size of the dataset. If the data object used by the Reader contains the dataset size, then the Ext.data.ProxyStore#getTotalCount function returns the dataset size. **Note**: see the Important note in Ext.data.ProxyStore#method-load. When store is filtered, it's the number of records matching the filter.
The number of Records in the Store.

items.name: getData
items.text: Returns the store's records. **Note:** If your store has been filtered, getData() will return a filtered collection. Use `getData().Ext.util.Collection#getSource to fetch all unfiltered records.

An Ext.util.Collection of records
(an empty Collection if no records are held by the store).

items.name: getDataSource
items.text: Returns the complete unfiltered collection.

items.name: getFilters
items.text: Gets the filters for this store.
The filters

items.name: getGroups

items.text: The grouped data

items.name: getId
items.text: Retrieves the id of this component. Will autogenerate an id if one has not already been set.
id

items.name: getModifiedRecords
items.text: Gets all Ext.data.Model added or updated since the last commit. Note that the order of records returned is not deterministic and does not indicate the order in which records were modified. Note also that removed records are not included (use getRemovedRecords for that).
The added and updated Model instances

items.name: getNewRecords
items.text: Returns all Ext.data.Model#property-phantom records in this store.
A possibly empty array of `phantom` records.

items.name: getRange
items.text:
Gathers a range of Records between specified indices.

This method is affected by filtering.

items.name: start
items.text: The starting index. Defaults to zero.

items.name: end
items.text: The ending index. Defaults to the last record. The end index **is included**.
An array of records.

items.name: getRawRemovedRecords
items.text:
Returns the array of records which have been removed since the last time this store was synced.

This is used internally, when purging removed records after a successful sync.
This is overridden by TreeStore because TreeStore accumulates deleted records on removal
of child nodes from their parent, *not* on removal of records from its collection. The collection
has records added on expand, and removed on collapse.

items.name: getRemovedRecords
items.text: Returns any records that have been removed from the store but not yet destroyed on the proxy.

The removed Model instances. Note that this is a *copy* of the store's
array, so may be mutated.

items.name: getSorters
items.text: Gets the sorters for this store.
The sorters

items.name: getState
items.text: Returns the grouping, sorting and filtered state of this Store.

items.name: getTotalCount
items.text: Returns the total number of Ext.data.Model instances that the Ext.data.proxy.Proxy indicates exist. This will usually differ from getCount when using paging - getCount returns the number of records loaded into the Store at the moment, getTotalCount returns the number of records that could be loaded into the Store if the Store contained all data

The total number of Model instances available via the Proxy. 0 returned if
no value has been set via the reader.

items.name: getUpdatedRecords
items.text: Returns all valid, non-phantom Model instances that have been updated in the Store but not yet synchronized with the Proxy.
The updated Model instances

items.name: group
items.text: Groups data inside the store.

items.name: grouper
items.text: Either a string name of one of the fields in this Store's configured Ext.data.Model, or an object, or a Ext.util.Grouper configuration object.

items.name: direction
items.text: The overall direction to group the data by. Defaults to the value of groupDir.

items.name: hasListener
items.text:
Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event, or whether the event bubbles. The answer
indicates whether the event needs firing or not.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to check for
`true` if the event is being listened for or bubbles, else `false`

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: hasPendingLoad
items.text: Returns true if the store has a pending load task.
`true` if the store has a pending load task.

items.name: isFiltered
items.text: Tests whether the store currently has any active filters.
`true` if the store is filtered.

items.name: isGrouped
items.text: Tests whether the store currently has an active grouper.
`true` if the store is grouped.

items.name: isLoaded
items.text: Returns `true` if the Store has been loaded.
`true` if the Store has been loaded.

items.name: isLoading
items.text: Returns true if the Store is currently performing a load operation
`true` if the Store is currently loading

items.name: isMoving
items.text: Checks whether records are being moved within the store. This can be used in conjunction with the event-add and event-remove events to determine whether the records are being removed/added or just having the position changed.

items.name: records
items.text: The record(s).

The number of records being moved. `0` if no records are moving. If records are passed
the number will refer to how many of the passed records are moving.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: isSorted
items.text: Tests whether the store currently has any active sorters.
`true` if the store is sorted.

items.name: isSuspended
items.text: Checks if all events, or a specific event, is suspended.

items.name: event
items.text: The name of the specific event to check
`true` if events are suspended

items.name: load
options
items.text: This is passed into the Ext.data.operation.Operation object that is created and then sent to the proxy's Ext.data.proxy.Proxy#read function. In addition to the options listed below, this object may contain properties to configure the Ext.data.operation.Operation.

items.name: callback
items.text: A function which is called when the response arrives.

items.name: records
items.text: Array of records.

items.name: operation
items.text: The Operation itself.

items.name: success
items.text: `true` when operation completed successfully.

items.name: addRecords
items.text:
Specify as `true` to *add* the incoming records rather than the
default which is to have the incoming records *replace* the existing stoire contents.
this

items.name: loadData
items.text: Loads an array of data straight into the Store. Using this method is great if the data is in the correct format already (e.g. it doesn't need to be processed by a reader). If your data requires processing to decode the data structure, use a Ext.data.proxy.Memory or loadRawData.

items.name: data
items.text:
Array of data to load. Any non-model instances will be cast
into model instances first.

items.name: append
items.text:
`true` to add the records to the existing records in the store, `false`
to remove the old ones first.

items.name: loadPage
items.text:
Loads a given 'page' of data by setting the start and limit values appropriately. Internally this just causes a normal
load operation, passing in calculated 'start' and 'limit' params.

items.name: page
items.text: The number of the page to load.

items.name: options
items.text: See options for method-load.

items.name: loadRawData
items.text: Loads data via the bound Proxy's reader Use this method if you are attempting to load data and want to utilize the configured data reader. As of 4.2, this method will no longer fire the event-load event.

items.name: data
items.text: The full JSON object you'd like to load into the Data store.

items.name: append
items.text:
`true` to add the records to the existing records in the store, `false`
to remove the old ones first.
`true` if the reader processed the records correctly. See Ext.data.reader.Reader#successProperty. If the reader did not process the records, nothing will be added.

items.name: loadRecords
items.text: Loads an array of Ext.data.Model instances into the store, fires the datachanged event. This should only usually be called internally when loading from the Ext.data.proxy.Proxy, when adding records manually use method-add instead

items.name: records
items.text: The array of records to load

items.name: addRecords
items.text: Pass `true` to add these records to the existing records, `false` to remove the Store's existing records first.

items.name: mon
items.text: Shorthand for addManagedListener.

items.name: mun
items.text: Shorthand for removeManagedListener.

items.name: nextPage
items.text: Loads the next 'page' in the current data set

items.name: options
items.text: See options for method-load

items.name: onAfter
items.text: Appends an after-event handler. Same as Ext.util.Observable#addListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onBatchComplete
items.text:
Attached as the 'complete' event listener to a proxy's Batch object. Iterates over the batch operations
and updates the Store's internal data MixedCollection.

items.name: onBatchOperationComplete
items.text:
Attached as the 'operationcomplete' event listener to a proxy's Batch object. By default just calls through
to onProxyWrite.

items.name: onBefore
items.text: Appends a before-event handler. Returning `false` from the handler will stop the event. Same as Ext.util.Observable#addListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onDestroyRecords
items.text: Removes any records when a write is returned from the server.

items.name: records
items.text: The array of removed records

items.name: operation
items.text: The operation that just completed

items.name: success
items.text: True if the operation was successful

items.name: onProxyLoad
items.text: Called internally when a Proxy has completed a load request

items.name: onProxyWrite
items.text:
Callback for any write Operation over the Proxy. Updates the Store's MixedCollection to reflect
the updates provided by the Proxy

items.name: previousPage
items.text: Loads the previous 'page' in the current data set

items.name: options
items.text: See options for method-load

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: queryRecords
items.text:
Query all the cached records in this Store by field.

This method is not affected by filtering, it will always search *all* records in the store
regardless of filtering.

items.name: field
items.text: The field from each record to use.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to match.
The matched records.

items.name: queryRecordsBy
items.text:
Query all the cached records in this Store using a filtering function. The specified function
will be called with each record in this Store. If the function returns `true` the record is
included in the results.

This method is not affected by filtering, it will always search *all* records in the store
regardless of filtering.

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters:

items.name: record
items.text: The record to test for filtering.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (this reference) in which the function is executed
Defaults to this Store.
The matched records.

items.name: rangeCached
items.text: Determines if the passed range is available in the page cache.

items.name: start
items.text: The start index

items.name: end
items.text: The end index in the range

items.name: rejectChanges
items.text: Ext.data.Model#reject outstanding changes on all getModifiedRecords and re-insert any records that were removed locally. Any phantom records will be removed.

items.name: relayEvents
items.text:
Relays selected events from the specified Observable as if the events were fired by `this`.

For example if you are extending Grid, you might decide to forward some events from store.
So you can do this inside your initComponent:

    this.relayEvents(this.getStore(), ['load']);

The grid instance will then have an observable 'load' event which will be passed
the parameters of the store's load event and any function fired with the grid's
load event would have access to the grid using the this keyword (unless the event
is handled by a controller's control/listen event listener in which case 'this'
will be the controller rather than the grid).

items.name: origin
items.text: The Observable whose events this object is to relay.

items.name: events
items.text:
Array of event names to relay or an Object with key/value
pairs translating to ActualEventName/NewEventName respectively. For example:
    this.relayEvents(this, {add:'push', remove:'pop'});

Would now redispatch the add event of this as a push event and the remove event as a pop event.

items.name: prefix
reload
options
items.text: A config object which contains options which may override the options passed to the previous load call. See the method-load method for valid configs.

items.name: remove
items.text: Removes the specified record(s) from the Store, firing the event-remove event for the removed records. After all records have been removed a single datachanged is fired.

items.name: records
items.text:
Model instance or
array of instances to remove or an array of indices from which to remove records.

items.name: removeAfterListener
items.text: Alias for unAfter.

items.name: removeAll
items.text: Removes all items from the store. Individual record event-remove events are not fired by this method.

items.name: silent
items.text: Pass `true` to prevent the event-clear event from being fired. This method is affected by filtering.
The removed records.

items.name: removeAt
items.text: Removes the model instance(s) at the given index

items.name: index
items.text: The record index

items.name: count
items.text: The number of records to delete

items.name: removeBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for unBefore.

items.name: removeFilter
items.text: Removes an individual Filter from the current cfg-filters using the passed Filter/Filter id and by default, applies the updated filter set to the Store's unfiltered dataset.

items.name: toRemove
items.text: The id of a Filter to remove from the filter set, or a Filter instance to remove.

items.name: suppressEvent
items.text: If `true` the filter is cleared silently.

items.name: removeListener
items.text: Removes an event handler.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The type of event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove. **This must be a reference to the function passed into the Ext.util.Observable#addListener call.**

items.name: scope
removeManagedListener
items.text: Removes listeners that were added by the mon method.

items.name: item
items.text: The item from which to remove a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the handler function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: removeManagedListenerItem
items.text: Remove a single managed listener item

items.name: isClear
items.text: True if this is being called during a clear

items.name: managedListener
items.text:
The managed listener item
See removeManagedListener for other args

items.name: resolveListenerScope
items.text:
Gets the default scope for firing late bound events (string names with
no scope attached) at runtime.

items.name: defaultScope
items.text: The default scope to return if none is found.
The default event scope

items.name: resumeAutoSync
items.text: Resumes automatically syncing the Store with its Proxy. Only applicable if autoSync is `true`

items.name: syncNow
items.text:
Pass `true` to synchronize now. Only synchronizes with the Proxy if the suspension
count has gone to zero (We are not under a higher level of suspension)

items.name: resumeEvent
items.text: Resumes firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to resume events, the events will fire when requested to fire. **Note that if the suspendEvent method is called multiple times for a certain event, this converse method will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to resume.

items.name: resumeEvents
items.text: Resumes firing events (see suspendEvents). If events were suspended using the `queueSuspended` parameter, then all events fired during event suspension will be sent to any listeners now.

items.name: discardQueue
items.text: `true` to prevent any previously queued events from firing while we were suspended. See suspendEvents.

items.deprecatedMessage: Will be removed in the next major version
items.name: save
items.text: Saves all pending changes via the configured proxy. Use sync instead.

items.name: setData
items.text: Loads an array of data directly into the Store. setData() is ideal if your data's format is already in its appropriate format (e.g. it doesn't need to be processed by a reader). If your data's structure requires processing, use a Ext.data.proxy.Memory or loadRawData. Use loadData, method-add, or insert if records need to be appended to the current recordset.

items.name: data
items.text:
Array of data to load. Any non-model instances will be cast
into model instances first.

items.name: setListeners
items.text: An alias for Ext.util.Observable#addListener. In versions prior to 5.1, listeners had a generated setter which could be called to add listeners. In 5.1 the listeners config is not processed using the config system and has no generated setter, so this method is provided for backward compatibility. The preferred way of adding listeners is to use the on method.

items.name: listeners
items.text: The listeners

items.name: setRecords
items.text:
Make a set of records be current in the store. This means that unneeded records
will be removed and new records will be added.

items.name: records
items.text: The records to be current in the store.

items.name: sort
sorters
items.text: Either a string name of one of the fields in this Store's configured Ext.data.Model, or an array of sorter configurations.

items.name: direction
items.text: The overall direction to sort the data by.

items.name: splice
items.text:
This method is basically the same as the JavaScript Array splice method.

Negative indexes are interpreted starting at the end of the collection. That is,
a value of -1 indicates the last item, or equivalent to `length - 1`.

items.name: index
items.text: The index at which to add or remove items.

items.name: toRemove
items.text:
The number of items to remove or an array of the
items to remove.

items.name: toAdd
items.text: The items to insert at the given `index`.

items.name: suspendAutoSync
items.text: Suspends automatically syncing the Store with its Proxy. Only applicable if autoSync is `true`

items.name: suspendEvent
items.text: Suspends firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to suspend events, the events will no longer fire when requested to fire. **Note that if this is called multiple times for a certain event, the converse method resumeEvent will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to suspend.

items.name: suspendEvents
items.text: Suspends the firing of all events. (see resumeEvents)

items.name: queueSuspended
items.text: `true` to queue up suspended events to be fired after the resumeEvents call instead of discarding all suspended events.

items.name: sync
items.text: Synchronizes the store with its proxy. This asks the proxy to batch together any new, updated and deleted records in the store, updating the store's internal representation of the records as each operation completes.

items.name: options
items.text: Object containing one or more properties supported by the sync method (these get passed along to the underlying proxy's Ext.data.Proxy#batch method):

items.name: batch
items.text: A Ext.data.Batch object (or batch config to apply to the created batch). If unspecified a default batch will be auto-created as needed.

items.name: callback
items.text:
The function to be called upon completion of the sync.
The callback is called regardless of success or failure and is passed the following parameters:

items.name: batch
items.text: The Ext.data.Batch that was processed, containing all operations in their current state after processing

items.name: options
items.text: The options argument that was originally passed into sync

items.name: success
items.text:
The function to be called upon successful completion of the sync. The
success function is called only if no exceptions were reported in any operations. If one or more exceptions
occurred then the failure function will be called instead. The success function is called
with the following parameters:

items.name: batch
items.text: The Ext.data.Batch that was processed, containing all operations in their current state after processing

items.name: options
items.text: The options argument that was originally passed into sync

items.name: failure
items.text: The function to be called upon unsuccessful completion of the sync. The failure function is called when one or more operations returns an exception during processing (even if some operations were also successful). In this case you can check the batch's Ext.data.Batch#exceptions array to see exactly which operations had exceptions. The failure function is called with the following parameters:

items.name: batch
items.text: The Ext.data.Batch that was processed, containing all operations in their current state after processing

items.name: options
items.text: The options argument that was originally passed into sync

items.name: params
items.text: Additional params to send during the sync Operation(s).

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope in which to execute any callbacks (i.e. the `this` object inside
the callback, success and/or failure functions). Defaults to the store's proxy.
this

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: un
items.text: Shorthand for removeListener.

items.name: unAfter
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: unBefore
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: $eventOptions
items.text: Matches options property names within a listeners specification object  - property names which are never used as event names.

items.name: addRecordsOptions
items.text: Used as a parameter to loadRecords

items.name: autoSyncSuspended
items.text: A counter to track suspensions.

items.name: complete
items.text: `true` once the store has loaded data from the server.

items.name: constructor
currentPage
items.text: The page that the Store has most recently loaded (see Ext.data.Store#loadPage)

items.name: data
items.text: The `data` property is a `Collection` which holds this store's local cache of records.

items.name: eventsSuspended
items.text: Initial suspended call count. Incremented when suspendEvents is called, decremented when resumeEvents is called.

items.name: factoryConfig
items.text: If this property is specified by the target class of this mixin its properties are used to configure the created Ext.Factory.

items.name: hasListeners
items.text: This object holds a key for any event that has a listener. The listener may be set directly on the instance, or on its class or a super class (via observe) or on the Ext.app.EventBus. The values of this object are truthy (a non-zero number) and falsy (0 or undefined). They do not represent an exact count of listeners. The value for an event is truthy if the event must be fired and is falsy if there is no need to fire the event. The intended use of this property is to avoid the expense of fireEvent calls when there are no listeners. This can be particularly helpful when one would otherwise have to call fireEvent hundreds or thousands of times. It is used like this: if (this.hasListeners.foo) { this.fireEvent('foo', this, arg1); }

items.name: implicitModel
items.text: The class name of the model that this store uses if no explicit model is given

items.name: isObservable
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Observable, or subclass thereof.

items.name: isStore
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Store, or subclass thereof.

items.name: lastOptions
items.text: Property to hold the last options from a method-load method call. This object is used for the method-reload to reuse the same options. Please see method-reload for a simple example on how to use the lastOptions property.

items.name: loadCount
items.text: The number of times records have been loaded into the store. This includes loads via loadData & loadRecords.

items.name: loading
items.text: `true` if the Store is currently loading via its Proxy.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: removed
items.text: Temporary cache in which removed model instances are kept until successfully synchronised with a Proxy, at which point this is cleared. This cache is maintained unless you set trackRemoved to `false`.

items.name: updating
items.text: A counter that is increased by beginUpdate and decreased by endUpdate. When this transitions from 0 to 1 the event-beginupdate event is fired. When it transitions back from 1 to 0 the event-endupdate event is fired.
